# bool

Boolean operations

| Operation       | Description
|-----------------|---------------
| [and](#and)     | Logical conjunction
| [false](#false) | False
| [not](#not)     | Negation
| [or](#or)       | Logical disjunction
| [true](#true)   | False


## and

The logical conjunction of *p0* and *p1*.

Aliases: `a`, `+`

	( p0:Bool p1:Bool -- Bool )

Example:

<!-- test: and -->

| Input                | Stack
|----------------------|---------------
| `c true  true   and` | `true` 
| `c true  false  and` | `false` 
| `c false false  and` | `false` 

## false

Places `false` on the stack

	(  -- Bool )

Example:

<!-- test: false -->

| Input   | Stack
|---------|---------------
| `false` | `false` 

## not

If `true`, returns `false`, otherwise returns `true`.

	( Bool -- Bool )

Example:

<!-- test: not -->

| Input      | Stack
|------------|---------------
| `true not` | `false` 
| `not     ` | `true` 

## or

The logical disjunction of *p0* and *p1*.

	( p0:Bool p1:Bool -- Bool )

Example:

<!-- test: or -->

| Input              | Stack
|--------------------|---------------
| `c true  true  or` | `true` 
| `c true  false or` | `true` 
| `c false false or` | `false` 

## true

Places `true` on the stack

	(  -- Bool )

Example:

<!-- test: true -->

| Input  | Stack
|--------|---------------
| `true` | `true`
